bank_interface

Class ProcessPasswordState

  • java.lang.Object
    • bank_interface.ProcessPasswordState

  • public class ProcessPasswordState
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by robert on 3/15/2015.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProcessPasswordState(CustomerInterface newCustomerInterface, BankProxy newBankProxy)
      the process password state represents the state of the customer interface when the customer enters an email that IS on record, and must now enter their password

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessPasswordState

        public ProcessPasswordState(CustomerInterface newCustomerInterface,
                            BankProxy newBankProxy)
        the process password state represents the state of the customer interface when the customer enters an email that IS on record, and must now enter their password
        Parameters:
        newBankProxy - new BankProxy object passed from the CustomerInterface constructor; used to retrieve customer information for password verification and etc.
        newCustomerInterface - instance of the customerInterface, used to set the customerInterface state

    • Method Detail

      • logOff

        public void logOff()
        saves current bank data to a file and logs the customer off

      • startTransaction

        public java.lang.String startTransaction(java.lang.String transactionChoice,
                                         java.lang.Integer accountFromNumber,
                                         java.lang.Integer accountToNumber,
                                         double withdrawAmount,
                                         double depositAmount)
        initiates a transaction for the customer
        Parameters:
        transactionChoice - String version of the user's transaction choice (transfer, withdraw, deposit)
        accountFromNumber - Account number of the account to take money FROM
        accountToNumber - Account number of the account ot put money IN
        withdrawAmount - Amount of money to withdraw. For transfers, this will equal deposit
        depositAmount - Amount of money to deposit. For transfers, this will equal withdraw
        Returns:
        returns feedback to the user depending on the outcome of the transaction process

      • addAccount

        public java.lang.String addAccount(java.lang.String accountRequest,
                                   double openingBalance)
        creates and adds a user specified account in the appropriate states
        Parameters:
        accountRequest - String representation of the account type requested by the customer
        openingBalance - opening balance passed to the account factory
        Returns:
        returns feedback to the user based on the outcome of the add account process

      • removeAccount

        public java.lang.String removeAccount(java.lang.Integer accountNumber)
        removes the account associated with the account number provided
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - account number of the account to be removed
        Returns:
        returns feedback based on the outcome of the account removal process

      • enterEmail

        public java.lang.String enterEmail(java.lang.String email)
        enterEmail not used in this state. If this method is ever invoked during this state, the customer is prompted for their password before allowing them to proceed.
        Parameters:
        email - customer's email
        Returns:
        returns feedback to the user based on the outcome of the email entering process

      • enterPassword

        public java.lang.String enterPassword(java.lang.String password)
        creates a final String variable "realPass" to store the value of the customer's actual password on file. Customer is prompted for their password as long as the String they entered does not match their password on file. Customers are given 5 attempts before the system exits. Upon a successful match, the current state is set to "LoggedOn" and the "requestInformation" method is invoked to initialize the logged-in process loop inside the LoggedOn class.
        Parameters:
        password - password to check for validity
        Returns:
        returns feedback to the customer depending on the outcome of the password entering process
